## kjournal-apiserver completion zsh

Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

### Synopsis

Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need
to enable it.  You can execute the following once:

	echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions in your current shell session:

	source <(kjournal-apiserver completion zsh); compdef _kjournal-apiserver kjournal-apiserver

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

#### Linux:

	kjournal-apiserver completion zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_kjournal-apiserver"

#### macOS:

	kjournal-apiserver completion zsh > $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh/site-functions/_kjournal-apiserver

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.


```
kjournal-apiserver completion zsh [flags]
```

### Options

```
  -h, --help              help for zsh
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
```

### SEE ALSO

* [kjournal-apiserver completion](kjournal-apiserver_completion.md)	 - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
